messages.message:
At least 4 deaths in Houston, official says, as storms bring ‘life-threatening’ flood risk to Texas and LouisianaA forecast model shows one way storms could develop late Thursday in the South.
Texas and Louisiana have been in the bull’s-eye of seemingly unrelenting rounds of torrential, flooding downpours since the start of April.
A tornado warning had been issued earlier Thursday evening in Harris County, Texas, including downtown Houston, according to the National Weather Service.
Serious flash flooding is likely in any areas caught under multiple storms unloading 2 to 3 inches of rain per hour.
Earlier this month, nearly 2 feet of rain fell in just five days and sent parts of eastern Texas underwater.

At least 4 deaths in Houston, official says, as storms bring ‘life-threatening’ flood risk to Texas and LouisianaA forecast model shows one way storms could develop late Thursday in the South.
Texas and Louisiana have been in the bull’s-eye of seemingly unrelenting rounds of torrential, flooding downpours since the start of April.
A tornado warning had been issued earlier Thursday evening in Harris County, Texas, including downtown Houston, according to the National Weather Service.
Serious flash flooding is likely in any areas caught under multiple storms unloading 2 to 3 inches of rain per hour.
Earlier this month, nearly 2 feet of rain fell in just five days and sent parts of eastern Texas underwater.

(Reuters) - A severe storm packing hurricane-force winds pummeled Houston on Thursday, killing at least four people, blowing windows out of high-rise buildings and leaving some 800,000 homes without power as much of the city was plunged into darkness, the mayor said.
The mayor said at least four storm-related fatalities had been confirmed, mostly from fallen trees.
Whitmire delivered similar initial storm assessments during a brief televised news conference carried live a short time after his interview.
The mayor said the severe weather had caught many residents by surprise, recounting that he was attending a little league baseball game when the storm hit, "and we had very little time to get to cover."
The National Weather Service also issued a flood watch for the Houston area from heavy rains associated with the storm.

(Reuters) - A severe storm packing hurricane-force winds pummeled Houston on Thursday, killing at least four people, blowing windows out of high-rise buildings and leaving some 800,000 homes without power as much of the city was plunged into darkness, the mayor said.
The mayor said at least four storm-related fatalities had been confirmed, mostly from fallen trees.
Whitmire delivered similar initial storm assessments during a brief televised news conference carried live a short time after his interview.
The mayor said the severe weather had caught many residents by surprise, recounting that he was attending a little league baseball game when the storm hit, "and we had very little time to get to cover."
The National Weather Service also issued a flood watch for the Houston area from heavy rains associated with the storm.

Here's a closer look at what holdover fires are and their threat to Western Canada.
The BC Wildfire Service defines a holdover as "a fire that remains dormant and undetected for a considerable time after it starts."
Of the 130 active wildfires burning across the province on Tuesday, 85 were holdovers from the 2023 fire season, Budd said.

The Government is set to construct a temporary drainage as a matter of urgency on the Kasoa to Winneba section of the N1 to mitigate the flooding situation on that stretch.
The debris, he said, blocked the flow of water through the drains, and consequently resulted in flooding the area.
The Minister of Roads and Highways admitted that there was a serious storm drainage issue in the area.
The Kasoa Old Barrier area is notoriously prone to heavy vehicular traffic, a situation that gets exacerbated when it rains.
Run-off and soil washed from the hills onto the road took over one side of the dual carriage road, compelling commuters on opposite directions to use just the other side of the road.

The Indonesia earthquake was reported hours after a 5.2-magnitude earthquake struck Chile on Monday (May 13), according to the United States Geological Survey.
The Chile earthquake was reported hours after a 6.4 earthquake was reported in Mexico, Guatemala and El Salvador on Sunday (May 12).
The latest California earthquake came weeks after a 4.3-magnitude earthquake struck the state on April 18, according to the United States Geological Survey.
A 6.1-magnitude earthquake struck Indonesia hours after a 6.5-magnitude earthquake struck a Japanese island region.
Both earthquakes reported days after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck Taiwan on April 22, according to the United States Geological Survey.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.9 (ml/mb) has occurred on Monday, South Sandwich Islands region (0 miles).
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
Id of earthquake: us6000mt07.
In the past 24 hours, there have been five, in the last 10 days seven, in the past 30 days seven and in the last 365 days seven earthquakes of magnitude 3.0 or greater that has struck near.
Read more about the earthquake, Distances, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Parameters, Location and details about this quake, that has struck: South Sandwich Islands region.

A moderate earthquake with magnitude 5.1 (ml/mb) was reported South Sandwich Islands region (0 miles) on Friday.
Id of earthquake: us6000mvz9.
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
In the past 24 hours, there have been nine, in the last 10 days fifteen, in the past 30 days seventeen and in the last 365 days seventeen earthquakes of magnitude 3.0 or greater that have been detected nearby.
Read more about the earthquake, Location, Distances, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Parameters and details about this quake, reported near: South Sandwich Islands region.

A light earthquake with magnitude 4.9 (ml/mb) was detected on Wednesday, 88 kilometers (55 miles) from Loreto in Mexico.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 10 km (6 miles).
Epicenter of the earthquake was 89 km (55 miles) from Loreto (c. 11 200 pop).
In the past 24 hours, there have been nineteen, in the last 10 days nineteen, in the past 30 days nineteen and in the last 365 days nineteen earthquakes of magnitude 3.0 or greater that has struck near.
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, that has occurred near: 88 km E of Loreto, Mexico.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.9 (ml/mb) has occurred on Wednesday, 76 kilometers (47 miles) from Loreto in Mexico.
The 4.9-magnitude earthquake has occurred at 11:58:07 / 11:58 am (local time epicenter).
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 10 km (6 miles) below the earth’s surface.
In the past 24 hours, there have been nineteen, in the last 10 days nineteen, in the past 30 days nineteen and in the last 365 days nineteen earthquakes of magnitude 3.0 or greater that has occurred nearby.
Read more about the earthquake, Distances, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Parameters, Location and details about this quake, that has struck: 76 km ENE of Loreto, Mexico.

A light earthquake with magnitude 4.9 (ml/mb) was detected on Monday, 22 kilometers (14 miles) from Hualien City in Taiwan.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 16.114 km (10 miles) below the earth’s surface.
Nearby country/countries that might be effected, Taiwan (c. 22 894 000 pop).

The epicenter of the earthquake was roughly 16.307 km (10 miles) below the earth’s surface.

At least four people died as the severe weather blasted through Houston, the mayor’s chief of communications Mary Benton told CNN.
The storm was so powerful that it blew out the windows of buildings in downtown Houston, littering the area with glass as traffic lights went dark.
Nearby, in College Station, videos shared with CNN on Thursday showed heavy rain flooding a park in the area.
CenterPoint Energy says its skyscraper in downtown Houston has sustained damage of the storm, according to a spokesperson.
He said there has been “extensive damage caused by these severe storms, historic river flooding, and tornadoes” that began on April 26.

At least four people died as the severe weather blasted through Houston, the mayor’s chief of communications Mary Benton told CNN.
The storm was so powerful that it blew out the windows of buildings in downtown Houston, littering the area with glass as traffic lights went dark.
CenterPoint Energy says its skyscraper in downtown Houston has sustained damage of the storm, according to a spokesperson.
Greg Abbott requested a presidential disaster declaration for areas of the state impacted by the recent onslaught of severe weather and flooding.
He said there has been “extensive damage caused by these severe storms, historic river flooding, and tornadoes” that began on April 26.

A rare "high risk" warning for flash flooding issued in Texas and Louisiana.
At least 4 dead in Houston after 'exceptionally' strong storm hits Texas: MayorStorms battered Texas and Louisiana late Thursday and early Friday with destructive winds and torrential rain, leaving at least four deadStorms battered Texas and Louisiana late Thursday and early Friday with destructive winds and torrential rain, leaving at least four deadStorms battered Texas and Louisiana late Thursday and early Friday with destructive winds and torrential rain, leaving at least four deadStorms battered Texas and Louisiana late Thursday and early Friday with destructive winds and torrential rain, leaving at least four deadHOUSTON -- At least four people have died Thursday after an "exceptionally" strong storm hit Texas, according to Houston Mayor John Whitmire.
Preliminary investigations indicate falling trees caused two deaths and a fallen crane caused one, according to Houston Police Chief Samuel Pena.
Urging Houston, Texas, residents to stay home, Whitmire said the city was in "recovery mode" and schools will be closed in the Houston area on Friday.
The storm first hit Texas on Thursday afternoon, bringing the heaviest rain from Dallas to Waco.

Urging Houston, Texas, residents to stay home, Whitmire said the city was in "recovery mode" and schools will be closed in the Houston area on Friday.
The storm first hit Texas on Thursday afternoon, bringing the heaviest rain from Dallas to Waco.
